info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:23PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A RAPIDLY DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF KENTON, CAMPBELL, SOUTHERN BOONE, EASTERN GALLATIN AND SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 223 PM EDT, a rapidly developing thunderstorm was located over Union, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Florence, Independence, Norwood, Erlanger, Fort Thomas, Newport, Edgewood, Alexandria, Elsmere, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Highland Heights, Taylor Mill, Bellevue, Fort Wright, Dayton, Ludlow and Southgate. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 66 and 77. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 10. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 169 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
